results.title: Doctors' orders
results.creator_credit: Colin Richards and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
After the publication of a report on prescribing in general practice, the program looks at the reasons for over-prescribing and talks to several general practitioners who feel they are being pressurised by both patients and drug companies into this expensive and potentially dangerous situation.

results.title: Cecily
results.brief_description: An animated film about a little girl who, discovering she can fly by flapping her ears, takes off for Africa. She makes friends with the elephants, who have ears as big as hers, and forms an elephant orchestra which becomes world famous. Based on the story by Milos Macourek.

results.title: Primary sources: the raw material of history
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to History”.
The film uses London as a place to show how different primary sources can be used to study its history. The primary sources include an excavated Roman bath-house, early documents, pottery, maps, paintings, business records and archival film.

results.title: The Other Face of the Ira
results.brief_description: An item from the American television program, “Sixty Minutes”, made at the time of the hunger strikes in H-block of Maze prison, attempting to analyse, through interviews, the political motivations and beliefs of the Provisional IRA

results.title: Effacement
results.brief_description: Solrun Hoaas’avant garde poetic tribute to Noh mask maker Taniguchi Akiko emphasises the relationship between the mask maker and her mask. It experiments with the visual and dramatic potential in Noh and in the mask, moving towards abstraction as the mask appears and re-appears in the reflection of a tree, its original substance.

results.title: Solo basic
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bill Brind and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Path of the Paddle”.
The joy and poetry of paddling solo are illustrated in this film, as are all the basic strokes used in maintaining complete control of the canoe. With the aid of animated lines, the path of the paddle is clearly defined so there can be no mistaking what the paddle is doing. The use of the various strokes in rapids is demonstrated sufficiently to whet the appetite to move on.

results.title: Parenting: stress and the child
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at some potentially stressful family situations for the child, such as the arrival of a baby, entry into a new school, and puberty. Indicates that, although stress is inevitable in children’s lives, once the causes are realised by parents, it can be utilised as a stepping stone towards emotional growth and family unity.

results.title: Seeds of revolution = Semillas de revolucion
results.creator_credit: Howard Enders, ABC Television (US) and Howard Enders Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary about the economic and social injustice in Hondouras. The present co-operation between the military government and the Standard Fruit Company is seen in the historical framework of class oppression and exploitation that may only be able to find its resolution through revolution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Enders, ABC Television (US) and Howard Enders Productions

results.title: [Noise] = Hearing conservation
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Tom Manefield, Dept of Science and Technology and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Serious hearing loss perpetrated in the industrial workplace is irreversible. This program portrays the peer pressures on the shop floor that might discourage workers from using protective devices - but at their peril. We see one factory worker who is teased about wearing his ear muffs, but his fantasies convince him that the consequences are worse than the flak he cops. A light-hearted drama which emphasises the necessity of using the correct protective gear at work. Stars Bryan Brown.
